text.more:
Developing language used to describe immigrant groups in the Pacific Northwest from 1880-1930, reflects labor, industrial and land development interests, which may still influence our perceptions today.

Circles are color coded by community and organized by associated industries, date and location of publication. 

Click on any item to bring up full text, metadata and link to item page. 

Fuchsia = Black  Red = Chinese  Light Purple = Irish  Orange = Italian  Dark Purple = Filipino  Brown = Finnish  Light Blue = German  Dark Blue = Greek  Pink = Hindu  Light Green = Japanese  Dark Green = Korean  Yellow = Native Americans  Dark Green = Norwegian  Aqua = Polish

Andrew Weymouth 2022 Capstone project for the University of Washington
text.intro:
Mapping Language: 
Representation of Immigrant Communities in the Pacific Northwest, 1880-1930
